gameTitle: Airship Rescue: The Plight of the Pangolin
gameDescription: Control advanced airship teams on a mission across the globe; aid in rescuing endangered pangolins from poachers, delivering them safely to a newly constructed rescue facility in Vietnam. Each decision affects the survival of the pangolins, the efficiency of the mission and the environment; success offers a beacon of hope for the survival of this heavily trafficked creature.

blueTeam.name: Greater Heights Guardians
blueTeam.description: Specializing in wildlife rescue and transportation.

redTeam.name: Skies of Safety
redTeam.description: Experts in combating wildlife trafficking and negotiation.

turns.scenario: Team locates a group of pangolins in the possession of poachers. They must decide what to do.

options.A: Try to negotiate with the poachers for the safe release of the pangolins.
options.B: Wait for nightfall and attempt a stealth rescue operation.

AA.narrative: Both teams chose to negotiate. Some poachers surrender, others become hostile. This unleashes a clash delaying the mission but resulting in a few pangolins recovered.

AB.narrative: Blue team negotiates while Red team waits till darkness for a stealth rescue. This combined effort confuses the poachers, leading to a significant pangolin rescue.

BA.narrative: Red team engages in negotiations while Blue carefully plans a stealth rescue. The distraction aids in liberating many pangolins unscathed.

BB.narrative: Both units decide to conduct a stealth operation. Despite the risks, they manage a successful large-scale rescue of the pangolins under the cover of darkness.

turns.scenario: The rescued pangolins are stressed and in dire need of care. The teams must decide on their approach.

options.A: Attempt to provide immediate on-board medical care despite the restrictive conditions in the airship.
options.B: Maintain minimum contact to reduce stress and directly head towards the facility for professional medical care.

AA.narrative: Both teams try to provide immediate care. They manage to stabilize some pangolins but risk lethal stress in others due to the restrictive conditions.

AB.narrative: While Blue team provides immediate care, Red team strives to reach the facility. The combined efforts result in the well-being of many pangolins. Red team’s approach proves less stressful.

BA.narrative: Red team provides immediate aid, while Blue team focuses on reaching the facility quickly. Despite a few panics, many pangolins remain stable thanks to Blue team’s less stressful approach.

BB.narrative: Both teams opt for minimal contact and expedite their flight. This decision proves fruitful as they arrive at the shelter promptly and the pangolins endure less stress.

turns.scenario: Teams receive news of more endangered pangolins en-route to the facility. They must decide whether to detour or stay on course.

options.A: Detour to rescue more pangolins, risking the well-being of those already onboard.
options.B: Stay on course to the facility, ensuring the safety of the current passengers.

AA.narrative: Both teams detour. They rescue more pangolins but deplete their resources and endanger the health of those onboard. Their decision strains the mission but results in more rescued pangolins.

AB.narrative: Blue team detours, while Red team remains on track. The decisions benefit them all: Red arrives at the shelter with healthy pangolins while Blue rescues more, though stresses their resources.

BA.narrative: Red team detours, Blue stays the course. This results in a successful balance as some pangolins are sheltered, and Blue rescues additional ones, though at the expense of overstressing the airship’s capacity.

BB.narrative: Both airships remain on course, ensuring the well-being of their pangolin passengers and promptly delivering them to the sanctuary. Other regional wildlife units respond to the additional pangolin distress calls.
